data.actual_result: Android won't parse content if a codeblock is present
data.expected_result: Content recognition feature of Android should work regardless of the presence of a codeblock
data.short_description: Android's content recognition feature won't work if there's a codeblock somewhere in the message
data.steps_to_repro: - Write a message with a content that the Android system is able to parse into a link. For example, a link without HTTP, a phone number, or a Google Map address - Send the message, you will see it working as normal (the content will render as a clickable link - Now either edit the message, or create a new one with the same content, and add a codeblock anywhere in the message (works with both single line and multi line codeblocks) - Send and observe
